contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Army-GRE-OF-01a.svg|thumb|right|80px|Current rank insignia of a Hellenic Army ''Ypolochagos''.]] '''''Ypolochagos''''' ({{Lang-el|Υπολοχαγός, abbreviated Υπλγος}}) is used in the modern [[Greek language]] to mean "[[First Lieutenant]]". In the modern [[Hellenic Army]] the rank is superior to that of ''[[Anthypolochagos]]'' (Literally: 'In place of-Lieutenant', i.e. [[Second Lieutenant]]) and inferior to that of an ''[[Lochagos]]'' ([[Captain (OF-2)|Captain]]). The insignia consists of two silver stars. Officers holding this rank should be addressed as "''Kyrie Ypolochage''" (Κύριε Υπολοχαγέ) by their subordinates, or "''Ypolochage'' + family name" by their superior officers. {{Greece officer ranks}} [[Category:Military ranks of Greece]] {{Greece-mil-stub}}
